moves.1... e5: What shall it be; Vienna, Bishop, Center Pawn, Center Game, Danish, King's Gambit, Petroff, Roy Lopez, Italian, or perhaps even the Fried Liver
moves.2. Nf3: Things are shaping up now. Ruy, Italian, or the Fried Liver would be fun!!
moves.2... Nf6: Oh, a switch-a-roonie by black, and out comes the Petroff. Very cool, I really enjoy the petroff!!
moves.3. Bc4: White takes a road somewhat less traveled here, the Petroff-Italian Variation. Now that we have our opening well established, let's see if White stays the course or risks uncharted waters. Should be fun!!
moves.3... Nxe4: I'm going to stay the course and play as accurate as I can, afterall my opponent has both tempo and out-rates quit a bit.
moves.4. Qe2: At this point the percentages favor black, but let's see if I have what it takes, it's early days still.
moves.5. Bb3: Nxe5 perhaps a little more accurate, Bb3 is still good. Lots of play remaining
moves.5... Bg4: Black continues to stay the course. These waters are still fairly well charted.
